quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: 80s and Liverpool

questions.question: Name this 90s western-based drama.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Violin and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, making, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the missing word from The Beatles song Help: And now my life has changed in oh so many ways, my ... seems to vanish in the haze?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Independence

questions.question: Which of these statements about violin tuning is correct?

options.text: A violin is tuned by loosening or tightening the pegs at the top or near the bridge.
The pegs at the top of the violin are those used in violin tuning.
A violin does not need to be regularly tuned; it usually keeps its tune for weeks.
Today violins can be electronically tuned.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A violin is tuned by loosening or tightening the pegs at the top or near the bridge.

questions.question: Joe Venuti and Stéphane Grappelli were both popular violinists famous for what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Playing jazz violin

questions.question: The violin parts of Benjamin Brittens Simple Symphony“ (movement two), the ninth movement of Bachs Magnificant”, and the third movement of Tachaikovskys 4th Symphony have what in common?

options.text: The violin part is all pizzicato.
The first and second violin parts are the same.
The second violins are not even on stage.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The violin part is all pizzicato.

questions.question: In a symphony orchestra there are usually how many violins?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 16 to 32

questions.question: Complete the line from The Beatles song That Means A Lot: A friend says that your ... wont mean a lot, and you know that your ... is all youve got?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Love

questions.question: What do you call a person whose profession is to make string instruments?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luthier

questions.question: From what song by The Beatles are the following lyrics: Nothing you can know that isnt known. Nothing you can see that isnt shown. Nowhere you can be that isnt where youre meant to be. Its easy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All You Need Is Love

questions.question: Complete the line the Beatles song Let It Be : And when the brokenhearted people living in the world agree, there will be , ... let it be.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An answer

questions.question: Which one is not a precursor of the modern violin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Celesta

questions.question: In the standard tuning, the four open strings on a modern violin correspond to what notes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: G, D, A, E

questions.question: Fill in the blank in The Beatles song I Am The Walrus: I am he as you are he as you are me, and we are all together. See how they run like ... from a gun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pigs

questions.question: Pizzicato is the plucking of the strings of a violin with the fingers, not with the bow. What is the playing technique which requires using the bow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arco

questions.question: Which of the following types of wood is not commonly used in violin crafting?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cherry

questions.question: What material is usually used in the making of the hairs of modern violins bows?

options.text: A mixture of synthetic materials and sheepgut

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Horsehair

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Carrie Underwood and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, title, piggies. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Winner of American Idol, Carrie Underwood gained a recording contract with which record label?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arista Records

questions.question: American singer Carrie Underwood was born on March 10, 1983 in Checotah, Oklahoma.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Is it true that in 2005, singer Carrie Underwood was voted Worlds Sexiest Vegetarian?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Who is Carrie Underwoods favorite singer according to her statement during American Idol auditions?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martina McBride

questions.question: What is the missing phrase from these lines of Beatles song Revolution 1: You say you got ... Well you know, wed all love to see the plan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A real solution

questions.question: What is the title of Carrie Underwoods debut album, released in November, 2005?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Some Hearts

questions.question: What are the piggies eating according to the Beatles song Piggies: You can see them out for dinner with their piggy wives, clutching forks and knives to eat their ...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bacon

questions.question: What is the name of the big fat bulldog in The Beatles song Leave My Kitten Alone?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mr. Dog

questions.question: Where is the hole according to this verse from the song Glass Onion by The Beatles: Fixing a hole in the ..., trying to make a dove-tail joint, yeah, looking through a glass onion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ocean

questions.question: Michael Jackson is one of the few artist to be inducted into The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame more than once.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Singer Carrie Underwood majored in mass communication, at which university?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Northeastern State University

questions.question: What Beatles song are these lyrics from: Your inside is out and your outside is in; your outside is in and your inside is out?

options.text: Everybodys Got Something to Hide Except Me and My Monkey

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Everybodys Got Something to Hide Except Me and My Monkey

questions.question: How old was Michael Jackson when he started out in The Jackson Five?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 11

questions.question: In 2001, American singer Carrie Underwood graduated from which high school?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Checotah High School

questions.question: Where was Michael Jackson born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Indiana

questions.question: Michael Jackson spoke publicly about his skin condition in an interview with this TV personality?

options.text: He never spoke publicly about it.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oprah Winfrey

questions.question: Which of these songs was sung by Sonny  Cher?

options.text: A Cowboys Work is Never Done

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Cowboys Work is Never Done

questions.question: Which of these groups sang A Horse with No Name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: America

questions.question: In the song Amos Moses by Jerry Reed, how did Amos earn his living?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: hunting alligators

questions.question: In the song A Boy Named Sue, sung by Johnny Cash, what did his daddy leave him and his ma, besides an empty bottle of booze?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: an old guitar

questions.question: This was the closing act on the opening night of the Monterey Pop Festival. The group featured Alan Price, Chas Chandler, Hilton Valentine, and Johnny Steel. They sang the song Monterey. What is the name of the band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Animals

questions.question: Whose funeral did Michael Jackson attend in December 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Browns

questions.question: Which of these groups performed An Old Fashioned Love Song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three Dog Night

questions.question: Which of these songs is featured on the Saturday Night Fever soundtrack?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Fifth of Beethoven

questions.question: Who recorded the single The Alley Cat?

options.text: Rick Dees  His Cast of Idiots

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bent Fabric

questions.question: What year was the Monterey Pop Festival held?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1967

questions.question: The song A Wonderful Dream was recorded by a group whose name refers to a rank in the armed forces. Can you march right up and single out the group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Majors

questions.question: The song Another Saturday Night was sung by both Sam Cooke and which of these artists?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cat Stevens

questions.question: The song At the Movies was brought to you by the same group that played the instrumental Popcorn. Name that group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hot Butter

questions.question: He was born John Henry Ramistella in New York City but was raised in New Orleans. Alan Freed convinced him to change his name. What name did he use as a performer at the Monterey Pop Festival?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Rivers

questions.question: Which singing group was the last group to perform at the Monterey Pop Festival?

questions.question: In what year did Jason Aldean release his first album Jason Aldean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2005

questions.question: Booker T. and the M.G.s was one of the top instrumental groups of the 1960s and 1970s. Which of these is a big 1962 hit of theirs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green Onions

questions.question: This group performed on the second day of the Monterey Pop Festival. The band included Roger McGuinn, David Crosby, Gene Clarke and various others. Which group was this American rock group famous for Mr. Tambourine Man?

questions.question: The song Closing Time was a big song for this one hit wonder in 1998.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Semisonic

questions.question: Which of these is the title of a song by singer Sinead O Connor who is considered a 90s one hit wonder in the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nothing Compares 2 U

questions.question: This group had a one hit wonder in 1992-93 with Rump Shaker.

questions.question: What group had a one hit wonder in 1995 with Roll to Me.

questions.question: This performer died soon after the Monterey Pop Festival. He wrote and/or sung many top hits. Who was this man who sat (Down at) The Dock of the Bay?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Otis Redding
